head.p: To: TimfromCanada@gmail.com CC: polly-bulldogge@veterinarianparty Subject: Come to Berlin!

p.s: hope youryou're doing well in Canada.
I really hope to meet up with you again after my exchange year last year, and since you were thinking about spending some time in Berlin I thought I might convince you with this article I found...
The article is called Berlin spricht Englisch and was published in an old newspaper, the Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung in July 2016.

add.s: Nevertheless the arguments still stad sloy!

p.s: The author begins by saying how most of Berlin is already English-speaking and becoming more and more so.

She talks about all the British, American and Australian tourists that go there every year and that, even though most are only there to study or as tourists, a large amount of them also settle down there.

She continues to describe many places with anglicanAnglican roots coming up more and more all over parts of Berlin and clearly underlines that you are off pretty bad if you can't speak any English in Berlin.

She finishes off by comparing Berlin to all the big cities around the world like Hongkong, Los Angeles and even Toronto where you live, but with the advantage of being far less expensive without losing any of the cultural aspects on the exciting night-life other big cities have to offer!

To sum it up once again for ya: You'll be off great here with youyour English, they speak it at every second corner, Berlin is way cheaper to live, go out and eat than other cities but still just as fun!
I can't wait to go out with you in Berlin and really hope to see you there ASAPAs soon as possible!
